permuta.mesh_pattern module¶

class permuta.mesh_pattern.MeshPattern(perm, mesh)¶

Bases: object

Class for instances of mesh patterns

add_point((x, y), shade_dir=-1, safe=True)¶

Returns a mesh pattern with a point added in (x,y). If shade_dir is specified adds shading in that direction

can_shade(pos)¶

Returns whether it is possible to shade the box pos

can_shade2(pos1, pos2)¶

Returns if it is possible to shade pos1 and pos2

contained_in(perm)¶

Returns whether a self is contained in perm

flip_antidiagonal()¶

Returns the Mesh Pattern self flipped along the antidiagonal, y=len(perm)-x

flip_diagonal()¶

Returns the Mesh Pattern self flipped along the diagonal, y=x

flip_horizontal()¶

Returns the Mesh Pattern self flipped horizontally

flip_vertical()¶

Returns the Mesh Pattern self flipped vertically

sub_mesh(positions)¶

Returns the mesh pattern given by using only points in positions from self. positions: 1-based indices of points

permuta.mesh_patterns module¶

class permuta.mesh_patterns.MeshPatterns(n, patt=None)¶

Bases: object

Class to allow for collections of MeshPatterns

random_element()¶

Returns a random MeshPattern of length n if patt with underlying pattern patt

permuta.permutation module¶

class permuta.permutation.Permutation(perm, check=False)¶

Bases: object

Base Permutation object

avoids(pattern)¶

Returns True if self contains no occurrence of pattern

contained_in(perm)¶

Returns true if the permutation self is contained in the permutation perm. self is treated as a pattern

contains(pattern)¶

Returns true if permutation self contains a given pattern

flip_antidiagonal()¶

Returns the permutation self flipped along the antidiagonal, y=len(perm)-x

flip_diagonal()¶

Returns the permutation self flipped along the diagonal, y=x

flip_horizontal()¶

Returns the permutation self flipped horizontally

flip_vertical()¶

Returns the permutation self flipped vertically

inverse()¶

Return the inverse of the permutation self

static to_standard(lst)¶

Returns the permutation given by mapping every element in lst to the lowest possible value that preserves order of the elements

permuta.permutations module¶

class permuta.permutations.Permutations(n)¶

Bases: object

Class for iterating through all Permutations of length n

random_element()¶

Returns a random permutation of length n
